text: Qiangba Puncog, also spelled Champa Phuntsok (; ; born in May 1947) was the chairman of the government of Tibet Autonomous Region of China from 2003 until January 2010. He is of Tibetan ethnicity. He was most visible in public during the 2008 Tibetan unrest, receiving diplomats and journalists. Qiangba Puncog resigned as chairman on January 12, 2010,Canada Tibet Committee | Newsroom | WTN and subsequently began serving as chairman of the Standing Committee of the People's Congress of the Tibet Autonomous Region. == Biography == Qiangba Puncog was born in Chamdo, Tibet in May 1947. He graduated from Chongqing University, and he joined in the Communist Party of China in 1974. == References == Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:People's Republic of China politicians from Tibet Category:Tibetan politicians Category:Communist Party of China politicians from Tibet Category:Vice Chairpersons of the National People's Congress Category:People from Chamdo Category:Political office-holders in Tibet
title: Qiangba Puncog
